summaries.brief_summary: Six PRs merged including new let expression syntax, toplevel -init/-e fixes, and documentation improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: New syntax for arbitrary structure items in let expressions, toplevel -init now works with -e flag
summaries.new_features:
- **Arbitrary structure items** now allowed in `let` expressions, enabling `let module rec`, `let exception`, `let open`, `let type`, and `let class` syntax within expression contexts ([#14040](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14040))
- **Toplevel `-init` flag** now properly loads initialization files when combined with `-e` flag for script execution ([#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190))
- **Iarray documentation** expanded with examples for constructing immutable arrays from array literals, plus additions to core library documentation ([#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397))

summaries.brief_summary: Seven PRs merged including String module enhancements, ld.conf relocatability improvements, and atomic record fields support
summaries.new_features_summary: New String predicates, external types documentation, relocatable ld.conf, native dynlink cleanup, debugger error messages
summaries.new_features:
- Added **String.{drop,take,cut}_{first,last}_while** functions for predicate-based string splitting operations in both `String` and `StringLabels` modules ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362))
- Implemented **atomic record fields** enabling lock-free concurrent programming with per-field atomic operations ([#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404))
- Enhanced **native dynlink** to call `dlclose` on dynamically loaded objects when errors occur, preventing resource leaks ([#14391](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14391))
- Improved **debugger error messages** to display specific information about incorrect or missing magic numbers rather than generic errors ([#14375](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14375))
- Introduced **relocatable OCaml installations** with explicit relative paths in `ld.conf` - paths like `.` and `..` now resolve relative to the ld.conf directory, and the default ld.conf uses relative rather than absolute paths ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Added **--with-additional-stublibsdir** configure option to prepend custom directories to ld.conf, and stublibs subdirectory is no longer created when building with --disable-shared ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Implemented **multiple ld.conf loading** - the runtime now loads from all of $OCAMLLIB/ld.conf, $CAMLLIB/ld.conf, and standard_library_default/ld.conf rather than just the first found ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Added **external types documentation** - new manual chapter explaining external types for FFI-populated values with examples for predefined types like float, string, and array ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- Updated **GADT tutorial** in manual to avoid using abstract types as indices, demonstrating proper usage with external types ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- Enhanced **ld.conf parsing** robustness - now handles CRLF line endings consistently on both Windows and Unix, and ocamlc uses the same C primitive-based parser as the runtime ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Documented **Ptype_external** in parsetree.mli to clarify the AST representation of external type declarations ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))

- **Developer experience** with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) adding AI.md guidelines ([#14383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14383)), [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) improving Git source archives ([#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152)), and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) integrating Merlin typing recovery ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- **Runtime and GC work** including [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) using memprof status field for minimal sampling ([#14384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14384)), [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) updating young-pointers after barrier ([#14306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14306)), and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) adding named GC parameters mechanism ([#14367](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14367))
- **Platform compatibility** with [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) fixing Windows socketpair AF_UNIX emulation ([#13450](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13450)) and improving AsciiDoc documentation ([#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392)), [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) updating shell scripts to use /usr/bin/env bash ([#14398](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14398)), and [Samuel Bronson](https://github.com/SamB) checking getentropy declaration ([#14382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14382))

summaries.trends_summary: Focus on relocatable installations, concurrent programming primitives, developer tooling, and standard library ergonomics
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Relocatable OCaml** becoming a major focus with comprehensive work spanning build system, installation, and package management to enable portable OCaml installations across different directory structures ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
- **Concurrent programming primitives** expanding with atomic record fields merged, atomic arrays in development, and multiple concurrent lazy evaluation strategies being explored for lock-free data structures ([#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404), [#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380), [#14043](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14043), [#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393), [#10798](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10798))
- **Standard library ergonomics** improving with systematic additions to String module for common text processing operations, reflecting broader effort to make standard library more practical ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362), [#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381), [#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14137))
- **Developer experience focus** with structured diagnostics, better error messages, spellchecking hints, and IDE integration improvements making the compiler more helpful and approachable ([#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766), [#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330), [#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241), [#14205](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14205))
- **Documentation completeness** addressing gaps in manual coverage of language features, particularly around external types, GADTs, and newer additions like immutable arrays ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994), [#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397), [#14386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14386))
- **AI-assisted contribution guidelines** emerging with dedicated documentation to help contributors use AI tools effectively while maintaining code quality standards ([#14383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14383), [#14052](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14052))

summaries.new_features:

- Fixed **data race in weak pointers** runtime with TSan-compliant relaxed atomic writes for ephemeron data by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) and [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) ([#14210](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14210))

- Improved **GC pacing** by resetting major GC's pacing clock after any synchronous GC work by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([#13736](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13736))

summaries.new_features_summary: Unix library socket API modernization and runtime improvements for GC pacing and callback safety
summaries.new_features:
- **Unix library socket API modernization** by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) deprecating `union sock_addr_union` in favor of standard `struct sockaddr_storage` and `socklen_param_type` in favor of `socklen_t`, with backward compatibility macros for C and C++ ([#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310))
- **Runtime callback safety fix** preventing segfaults by ensuring C callback mechanism properly calls `caml_continuation_use` when handling continuations, addressing dropped continuation issues ([#14337](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14337))
- **GC ephemeron accounting improvements** removing quadratic term from ephemeron marking work calculation to improve garbage collection pacing accuracy ([#14336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14336))
- **GC work accounting fixes** correcting domain-local work counter tracking for mark and sweep phases to prevent pacing logic errors ([#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))
- **Runtime header improvements** making `<caml/osdeps.h>` self-standing by adding necessary includes, improving C extension compatibility ([#14342](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14342))

summaries.new_features_summary: Existential types in as-patterns, improved error messages, and TSan instrumentation fixes
summaries.new_features:
- **Existential types** now supported in as-patterns, completing previous work and lifting restrictions on retyping patterns containing existentials ([#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327))
- **Recursive module error messages** improved with abstract environment for printing `-short-paths` and added error message for types considered abstract during recursive module checking ([#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037))
- **Pattern constraint handling** cleaned up by removing legacy hacks, with behavior change that `let rec (_ as x) = ...` is now consistently rejected instead of being treated as `let rec x = ...` ([#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322))
- **Type-level scope documentation** added with detailed explanation of `Ctype.create_scope` and enforcement of `current_level <= generic_level` invariant ([#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331))
- **TSan instrumentation** fixed to properly instrument subexpressions and shared heap operations, addressing race detection gaps ([#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332), [#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335))
- **Dune build support** restored with fixes for label reordering and iarray availability in OCaml 5.4 ([#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328))

summaries.brief_summary: Major week for OCaml with 12 PRs merged including GC performance improvements, better error messages, and new memory statistics
summaries.new_features_summary: Added Gc.Memprof.is_sampling function, restored stack statistics in Gc.stat, and improved row type display in error messages
summaries.new_features:
- **Memprof sampling control** added `Gc.Memprof.is_sampling` function allowing domains to replace profiles without stopping in all domains ([#14053](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14053))
- **GC statistics enhancement** restored `stack_size` field and added new `live_stacks_words` field to `Gc.stat` for tracking total size of live stacks ([#14168](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14168))
- **Error message improvement** for row types in GADT constructors now display as `< foo : int; .. as $0>` when type variables are introduced by constructors ([#14147](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14147))
- **Deprecation alert fix** added proper file location to deprecation alerts for implicit library usage (unix, threads, dynlink) ([#14176](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14176))
- **Value restriction relaxation** for `%identity` primitives like `Obj.magic` which are now recognized as nonexpansive ([bab7aa8a58](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/bab7aa8a5838830b5bb41a3c4b12dcd058665344))
- **GC performance improvement** introduced sweep-only phase at start of major GC cycle to reduce latent-garbage delay ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13580))

- **Module pattern parsing** enhancement by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) distinguishes between `(module M : S)` and `(module M) : (module S)` in pattern matching ([#14149](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14149))
- **Shared heap optimization** by [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) implements run-length encoding for free blocks, achieving 3.85x performance improvement for sparse heaps ([#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- **Symbol name compatibility** fix by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) restores perf/flamegraph.pl support while maintaining lldb debugging on macOS ([#14143](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14143))

summaries.brief_summary: Active week with 9 PRs merged, improved error messages for external declarations and type printing, plus GC and runtime fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved error messages for external declarations, better type printing in row types, memprof compositional improvements

- **Gc.Memprof** interface made more compositional allowing `start` to be called when profile already sampling, with new `is_sampling` function ([#14053](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14053))
- **Symbol naming** reverted to using `.` as module separator on non-Apple Unix systems to restore perf tool support ([#14150](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14150))
- **C++ compatibility** improvements by moving atomic helper type definitions inside `caml/misc.h` ([#14139](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14139))
- **Constraint terminology** cleanup renaming `cstrs` to `constraints` throughout codebase to avoid confusion with constructors ([#14141](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14141))
- **Minor heap decommission** fix ensuring domains properly decommit minor heap when leaving STW participant set ([#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152))
- **Consistent GC logging** using `caml_gc_log` instead of `CAML_GC_MESSAGE` for memprof minor GC operations ([#14151](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14151))
- **Package type cleanup** removing unused `tpt_type` field from `package_type` in typedtree ([#14148](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14148))
- **Test suite improvements** fixing unexecuted phrases in expect tests and missing expectations ([#14155](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14155))

summaries.brief_summary: New variance debugging features merged alongside performance regression reports for OCaml 5
summaries.new_features_summary: New `-i-variance` command-line flag and bivariance syntax support for type variance debugging
summaries.new_features:
- New **`-i-variance` command-line flag** allows developers to print inferred variances for all types in their programs, useful for debugging and learning about type variance ([#13820](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13820))
- **Bivariance syntax support** with new `+-` notation for bivariant type parameters (e.g., `type +-'a t = A`), including parser and pretty-printer updates ([#13820](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13820))
- **Enhanced shape indexing** for all path components improving editor support and IDE integration ([#13848](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13848))
- **Float.Array performance optimizations** with `@@noalloc` and `@inline` attributes added to `Float.Array.fill` for better unboxing opportunities ([657a50f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/657a50ff726f8958ccda79a4ef2ed6a476228f97), [b5f2f49](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/b5f2f49b6437b663e28c3a36303cd9b7b0a1b3b5))
summaries.activity_summary: Performance regression discussions dominated activity with detailed reports from Semgrep and EasyCrypt teams
summaries.activity:
- **GC performance investigations** initiated by [Nat Mote](https://github.com/nmote) from Semgrep reporting poor garbage collection behavior on OCaml 5, requiring `space_overhead` tuning to achieve OCaml 4 parity ([#13868](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13868))
- **EasyCrypt performance regression** reported by [Pierre-Yves Strub](https://github.com/strub) showing extreme slowdowns from OCaml 4 to OCaml 5, with compilation times increasing from minutes to hours ([#13849](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13849))
- **Variance feature development** completed by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) and [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) with comprehensive variance debugging tools merged after extensive review process ([#13820](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13820))
- **Standard library enhancements** delivered including new `Repr` module and `Float.Array.{equal,compare}` functions expanding the stdlib API ([#13755](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13755), [#13836](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13836))
summaries.discussions_summary: PDF manual typography improvements discussed with font comparison samples
summaries.notable_discussions: - **PDF manual typography enhancement** discussion initiated by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) presenting three font options (Palladio, Schoolbook, Utopia) for improving the manual's visual appeal, with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) providing readability feedback favoring Schoolbook ([#13871](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13871))

summaries.discussions_summary: Major performance regression analysis for OCaml 5 and ThreadSanitizer test reliability issues
summaries.notable_discussions:

- **ThreadSanitizer test reliability** discussion addressing non-deterministic error output ordering between OCaml stack traces and TSan race reports affecting test consistency across Linux and macOS platforms ([#13831](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13831))
- **Signal support** feature request for missing signals like SIGWINCH in the standard library enum with reference to ongoing work ([#13825](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13825))

summaries.brief_summary: Standard library enhancements and runtime improvements delivered with three new functions and performance optimizations
summaries.new_features_summary: New Standard library functions: Result.retract, Either.retract, Seq.filteri, plus ARM64 compiler fixes and Weak module performance improvements
summaries.new_features:
- **Standard library additions**: Three new functions added for improved type ergonomics - [Result.retract](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/8273fc78f3ee26eb30f60103751e5835c00ce5c6) extracts values from homogeneous Result types, [Either.retract](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/49baed77c5e7f1f83f39220d5a0c2bc89ffc446f) does the same for Either types, and [Seq.filteri](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/b2ee286390a47c5ec6f98d7c6add57fb21f7f947) provides indexed filtering for sequences
- **Performance improvements**: Weak module optimizations including [closure allocation reduction in Weak.add](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/2da20f7641342c880289c850e83d4f2f58ba23c8) during table resizing and [improved Weak.find_aux performance](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/8f2daefea61762313728a38e415c00b6cad903ca)
- **ARM64 compiler fixes**: Fixed [instruction size computation on ARM64](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/930d7e24241f9b48aa5e6f410a325ec1cd685a48) addressing long-standing code generation issues and added `enable-codegen-invariants` flag for debugging
- **Test infrastructure**: String starts_with/ends_with tests [now run unconditionally](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/137dd26adc3345547b6eef6da744ac0d66fbc209) improving test coverage, and fixed [Coccinelle test naming and Cygwin compatibility](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/21a98e6a3f87bc26209465bffc58034a7fe3df92)
